intro: Taraxacum taeniatum f. taeniatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and yellow composite flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. The plant is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. It has a taproot system and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. The species is also valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
